path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/Lybra Finance Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf

findings.title: B3. Use latest libraries
findings.description: In contract PublicSale there is use of MerkleProof library which is a bit older and can have bugs.

findings.title: Immutable Contract Address Variable
findings.description: lbr contract address variable can be immutable to save gas.

findings.title: General Recommendation: Softcap and hardcap variables can be constants to save gas
findings.description: Softcap and hardcap variables can be declared as constants to optimize gas usage.

findings.title: General Recommendation: require(block.timestamp > endTime)
findings.description: In require statements, using block.timestamp >= endTime can lead to potential issues and it is recommended to use block.timestamp > endTime instead.

findings.title: General Recommendation: Use safeTransfer instead of just transfer in sendToken function
findings.description: Using 'transfer' instead of 'safeTransfer' in the 'sendToken' function may cause issues if the token is not completely ERC20 compliant, potentially leading to stuck tokens.

findings.title: A1. Centralization issue
findings.description: In contract LBR there is burn() function which is controlled by a lybra address which might be an owner address. But it can mint() and burn also. If the lybra address private key gets leaked or the account is hacked then a malicious user can burn anyones tokens.

findings.title: B1. Low test coverage
findings.description: Low test coverage was identified in the contract.

findings.title: B2. Use of transfer function instead of call for eth transfer
findings.description: In PublicSale contract transfer is used for eth transfer which is not recommended. Transfer will always send ETH with a 2300 gas.

findings.title: No functionality to withdraw deposits if something goes wrong
findings.description: In contract PublicSale there is no functionality which can let users withdraw their deposits if something goes wrong.
